scenario_text.value: Oh, look, Takuma, it’s Shuuji and Lopmon!

You’re right. What’re they doing in a place
like this?

Hey, you can’t even do a single push-up?!
You think I’d be satisfied with that?!
B-but it’s hard...
No excuses!
Eek!

You said you’d accept my training, so no
backtalk!

Enough push-ups! We’re moving on to squats!
Get to it!

Serious about that special training, huh
Shuuji?
Oh, Takuma. Of course I’m serious.

If I make him stronger, then everyone will
have to recognize me...

(I can’t imagine this would make a monster
stronger. They’re not like normal creatures.)

(This sort of thing would only hurt them.
It’s basically the same as bullying them.)

(But I wonder if I can get that concept
across to him? Must be a way...)
(What should I tell Shuuji?)
Will this work?
This isn’t training.
How about a break?

Shuuji, do you really think this kind of
training will make him stronger?
You saying my way of doing things is wrong?

I mean, just look at Lopmon. What’s the point
in training such small limbs?
That’s true... Damn, how useless can you get!
I, I’m sorry...

No, that’s not it! These guys get stronger by
evolving, so muscle training won’t make a—
Says who?!
Urk...

Sorry, but this is all to train his spirit,
and that spoiled attitude of his.
Please don’t interfere.

This isn’t training. You’re basically
bullying the poor guy.
This is the wrong way to do things.
Is that right...? Then what’s the right way?
Well... I mean, it’s obvious that this isn’t—

Don’t criticize if you don’t have any
alternatives to offer.

What proof do you have that you’re so right?
We can’t say if this’ll work unless we try.

Please stay out of this. You’re interrupting
my training.
How about taking a break, Shuuji?
Not yet, he still has some fight in him!

I’m talking about you, not Lopmon. It must be
exhausting supervising such strict training.

Oh... Um, yeah, I guess you’re right. My
throat’s gotten parched from yelling so much.
I appreciate your consideration, Takuma.
You okay, Lopmon?! Are you okay?
Yeah...

(This should give Lopmon a chance to rest,
but it’s only a temporary fix.)

(I have to do something but...exactly what,
I don’t know.)

Right, back to training! Get the lead out,
slowpoke!
This isn’t right! Poor Lopmon!
But then what’s the right thing to do here?
I don’t know, it’s just...

That’s the problem, isn’t it. I have no idea
what to do...

(Shuuji’s reckless training continues. He
won’t listen to a word I say.)
